I wasn't expecting much when I started playing Borderlands 2 after finishing the first game. The first game was a nice first person shooter Diablo 2 style looting and levelling up affair for me and that is fine. More of the same in the sequel would have been completely okay by me, however the sequel improves upon the original in nearly all aspects.

First up is the combat, the enemy varietly and AI behaviors have been improved significantly compared to the first game. The weapon animations and feedback and even the weapon models are quite a bit more varied and feel really fun to use. The core shooting part of this first person shoother somehow manages to stay fresh and exciting even a hundred hours into the game.

Second improvement is the story, now the first game didn't have much of a story to begin with, it mostly had some vibes and quite a lot of desert atmosphere, which I enjoyed, but I wouldn't want to spend a hundred hours in multiple consequtive character playthroughs. The second game actually introduces a crazy cast of villans and heroes, a ton more varied biomes, plus adds personality and story to already existing characters from the first game and actually has a plot and story that has ups and downs and some twists. I mean don't expect Disco Elysium levels of story and writing here no, but for a silly game about shooting a lot of things, this game has no right to have such an interesting story with a cast of characters this engaging.

And finally the loot system is completely overhauled. Weapon classes have distinct characteristics and on top of that weapon manufacturers have distinct characteristics in their respective weapon types. Add on top of that the randomly generated weapon parts system, and you have an insane loot table that can generate Epic and Legendary weapons that you actually want to use with the higher difficulties.

However not everything about the game is amazing, at launch this game had performance issues (oh look Borderlands 4 also has those) and years down the line more powerful CPUs can indeed brute force through the optimization problems, but can't create miracles. I went back and tested the game with an era appropriate 2014 powerful gaming PC (with a dedicated PhysX card) and I was dropping frames down to 30s with averages around 60. Using my 2023 machine I was dropping frames down to 60s with averages around 150. The fix for the abysmal performance is using a modern translation tool called DXVK that translates the old unoptimized DX9 calls to more modern VULKAN. Using that, my 2014 PC went up to 85 FPS average with 60 minimums, while the 2023 PC went over 200 FPS average with minimums of 120. Oh and the game loves to crash sometimes, if you play for like 3 or 4 hours and load in multiple areas, yeah it will crash randomly, no fix for it exists unfortunately. I say you should restart the game completely every 1.5 hours of game time to avoid the nasty crashing.

Borderlands 2 is not just a game. It's a cult, it's adrenaline, it's an endless stream of guns, memes and cries of ‚ÄúSUPER-BAMBI!".

I went through it three times‚Äî on normal, on "Warrior" and on "Vault Killer". And every time, it's like the first time. Because Borderlands 2 is not just a shooter with RPG elements. It's a living universe where every shot is a celebration, every weapon is a character, and every boss is a spectacle.

Gameplay: Chaos that works
I must say right away that Borderlands 2 is not for everyone. If you like quiet tactics, slow decisions and realistic physics, alas, absolute chaos with guns awaits you here. But if you're ready for it, you'll be in heaven.

A weapon is not an inventory. It's a personality.
There is no "regular pistol" here. There are "Pistol Song", "Blood Rain", "Plasma Nail", "Dancing Dead Man" - each weapon has its own style, its own animation, its own effects. And most importantly, each of them is unique in terms of stats. Even two Magnums can be completely different: one with huge damage but slow reloading, the other with fast shooting and recoil that will send you flying.

Life hack: Always check your weapon before buying or picking it up. Sometimes a "rare" item turns out to be worse than a "regular" one because it has unsuitable modifiers. 

üß† Classes are not just a choice. This is the philosophy of the game
Borderlands 2 has 4 classes (and 4 DLC classes, but we're still talking about the base):

Soldier (Axel) is a tank, the backbone of the team. Puts up shields, summons mini-tanks, holds the line. Ideal for beginners.
Hunter (Maya) is a magical killer with a "Phase Capture". Slows down time, makes enemies vulnerable. A very technical class.
Ninja (Sullivan) is a master of melee combat and explosions. Explosive rage-based abilities. Fast pace, high risk.
Engineer (Gage) ‚Äî robots, traps, drones. Controls the battlefield. Requires an understanding of positioning.
 Tip: If you're playing alone, choose a Soldier or an Engineer. They are the most versatile. Maya is for the experienced, Sullivan is for the adrenaline rush. 

The universe: sarcasm, madness and depth
Pandora is not just a planet. It's a mix of post-apocalypse, cowboy western and science fiction with a touch of absurdity. They talk like in comics here, the script is filled with sarcasm, memes and unexpected twists.

The main antagonist, Hendrix, is the perfect villain: self‚Äîconfident, charismatic, with a wild way of speaking. His voice is a special pleasure. And his goal? Just to make you all become his slaves... and look cool at the same time.

ü§ñ Feature: all NPCs are alive. They joke, they argue, they react to your reputation. I especially remember Jack, who always sticks into the ether and mocks you. 

üìà Progress: from "beginner" to "vault killer"
The level system is one of the best in the genre. You don't just rock the character ‚Äî you build it. Each level gives a skill point, which can be invested in one of the three branches.:

Basic ability
Support / Survival
Damage / Control
This allows you to create unique builds. For example:
‚Üí ‚ÄúDancing Dead‚Äù + ‚ÄúPhase capture‚Äú + "Acceleration‚Äù = You turn into a rabid killer clown who dances between enemies and kills them with one shot.

And after level 50, the "Warrior" Mode begins, where everything becomes more difficult and the enemies become stronger. And then you realize that Borderlands 2 is not the end, but the beginning.

üéÆ Co-op: the best multiplayer shooter in history
The game was created for co-op. Four players ‚Äî four classes ‚Äî four styles of play. Together you can:

Kill bosses that are beyond the power of one
Exchanging weapons (and teasing each other)
Solve puzzles (for example, in the "Abandoned Mine")
Just have fun while someone shouts "I found a legend!" and everyone runs to him.
The trick: in a co-op, you can use common inventory, and this saves you in critical situations. Especially when one player has a "Super-Bambi" and the other has a "Dancing Dead Man". 

üé® Graphics and sound: stylization instead of realism
Borderlands 2 uses stylized comic book-style graphics. This is not a disadvantage ‚Äî it is a corporate identity. The colors are bright, the textures are simple, but the atmosphere is excellent.

Sound is a separate art. The music is a mix of country, rock and electronica. The sounds of weapons are loud, clear, and full of character. And the voices of the characters are legendary. Especially Jack and Tina.

üí• Bosses: not just enemies. It's a show
Each boss is a different difficulty level and a spectacle. From the "Bandit Boss" in the first act to the "Pandora's Heart" at the end, everyone demands their own tactics.

, Favorite boss: The "Blood Dragon" is a huge mechanical dragon that flies, shoots missiles and screams: "I AM THE BLOOD DRAGON! I am DEATH!"
And he falls down and screams, "NO! I DON'T WANT TO DIE!" and it's incredibly funny and epic. 

The little things that make the game great
The system of "Contracts" ‚Äî complete tasks, get bonuses.
The ratings of the "Vault Killer" open up new difficulties.
DLC content is not just add-ons, but full‚Äîfledged chapters with new locations, bosses, and plots.
Super Bambi is a legendary weapon that shoots teddy bears that explode within a 10-meter radius. Yes, it really works.
‚ùó Cons? Of course there is.
Repetitive locations ‚Äî especially in the middle of the game.
Buggy physics ‚Äî sometimes enemies get stuck, weapons disappear.
A limited dialog system ‚Äî there are no options to choose from except "yes/no".
The end of the game may seem stretched if it is not involved.
But these disadvantages do not spoil the impression. They're part of this crazy world.

Bottom line: why is Borderlands 2 a masterpiece?
Because she's:

 Creates a unique atmosphere

Scheduling becomes the actual boss fight.

I just went through this game again.  Borderlands 2 hasn't significantly changed from Borderlands 1. It still has insufferable delays and bad targeting when picking up items.  It still cuts the timer down every time you lose all your HP, so free-for-alls are death, and sniping is the only legitimate way to pay the game.  It's easier to shoot the helmets off the goliath enemies and let them berserk-attack everything around them than to fight them yourself.  There was one quest I never managed to find the trigger for, since none of the characters in the region had the exclamation point (!) showing where to activate it.  The classes aren't as good as the B1 classes, either.

One of the worst things is a grinder later in the game - if you accidentally drop one of your good items in the grinder, it's gone forever.  I know, I lost my best SMG by accident because it destroyed it.  No recovery possible, even though it was supposed to only chew up shield items.  You get nothing from grinding anything else.

This game is basically just like Borderlands 1 with a slightly better storyline (Jack is one of the best-written antagonists ever), but that really isn't enough to justify playing the game.  Also, we know from B1 that Roland used the New-U and Fast Travel systems.  So, when at a certain point, he is *permanently killed*, it makes ZERO sense at all.  Also, if Hyperion runs the New-U system, why doesn't Jack just shut it off for Pandora and solve the problem really quickly?  The story doesn't make any sense.  Like I said for B1, it's Serious Sam but without the seriousness.  Find another FPS, this one gets boring and frustrating very quickly.
